Question: The 1st United States Congress voted to pay this person a salary of $25,000 a year—a large sum in 1789.
Hints: Afterwards, the British continued to head towards New York, and this person moved his army outside of New York.
Today, this person's face and image are often used as national symbols of the United States.
Starting with victory in their Revolution, there were many proposals to build a monument to this person.
